author: sethlee
title: savier
review: I really like this set 1 driver and 1 boat 2005 did a really great job to count this set even has a black close super nice I wish I have this set it will go well in my lego collection of lego city and some other lego sets.

author: Wolfagar
title: Thieves to the water!
review: Well the policeman minifig has completed my entire police headquarters, it is great and the lifejacket makes this minifig great for a collection. The boat, sorry to say, but doesn't like me, i used some pieces for other lego stuff. By the way you can't expect an super awesome set if it is a promotional, so its another nice set!

author: Quotex
title: A well detailed build for the amount of parts it uses.
review:
I bought this set via bricklink, so I can't really review value-for-money, as it is a discontinued set.

This is a rather simple to build set, the instruction has 6 easy-to-follow steps to complete the jetski.

The parts themselves are very simple to place, although the Antenna piece has a tendency to fall out of the holes in the fence. so beware when holding it upside down.

The minifigure is nice but would've been better if it had a print on the cap, like a few other sets have had (although that was a black cap, this white one contrasts with the black uniform nicely).

Because this is a water vehicle, I decided to put it through a float-test, upon placing it in the water the jetski, unfortunately flipped onto its side. so it's not recommended for displaying it in dioramas that use actual water.

Overall, it's a simple but effective build.
